title: godsworn_alexiel
body:
Character from [[Shingeki no Bahamut]] and [[Granblue Fantasy]]. Generally referred to as Alexiel.

Alexiel is a Primal Beast who serves as the disciple to [[Uriel (Granblue Fantasy)|Uriel]]. Her stoic and [[serious]] personality stands in direct and stark contrast to her master's jovial and boisterous attitude. Once a defender of the god-realm, a chance meeting with the primarch of earth led her to become his disciple. She protects the weak and reviles evil. And with her mirror-blades, she brings righteousness and justice to them both.

A divine servant not seen since antiquity reconnects with a world unfamiliar to her. Initially overwhelmed by the evolution of civilization, she's since become quite taken with its earthly pleasures. Upon discovering the existence of "chocolate", she luxuriates in a realm of newfound delights.

body:

title: europa_(holiday)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:

As holiday cheer fills the air, one maiden ponders deeply over what to give to a special someone. The present she settles on is more fitting for royalty than the captain of a boisterous skyfaring crew, which begs the question: is there such a thing as having too much affection for one person?

body:

title: alexiel_(noble_triteleia)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
An official alternative outfit of [[godsworn_alexiel|Godsworn Alexiel]] released for the 8th anniversary of [[Granblue_Fantasy|Granblue Fantasy]]. Released March 10th, 2022.

Many twists and turns went into the making of the luxurious formalwear that enrobes Alexiel. At first, she asked for Uriel's help, but the finished product mightily offended the aesthetic sense of Gabriel, who took the matter into her own hands. Having passed through a maelstrom of refashioning at the hands of the water primarch to reach the final look, Alexiel later had this to say: "The pursuit of beauty is a voyage through a great storm—its winds capable of whipping even the most serene of waters into a frenzy."

title: alexiel_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[godsworn_alexiel|Godsworn Alexiel]] in her summer outfit. Released August 15th, 2019.

Drawn to the azure seas, alabaster sands, and scorching sun, this noble defender of the god-realm descends upon the sandy beach. Slipping on a meticulously chosen piece of swimwear, the divine beauty is ready to revel in her summer reprieve.

title: ufo
body:
Short for "Unidentified Flying Object". Stereotypical depiction of an [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] originated from various description of the supposed spotting of alien spacecraft during the 1950 - 1970s "UFO craze" around the Americas.

The most common depiction of UFO are a "[[flying saucer]]", a disc-shaped spacecraft often with a glass canopy for its occupant. Though other types such as a sphere and a cigar-shaped UFO is also often depicted.

h4.See also

title: palanquin_ship
body:
An [[airship]] from [[Touhou]].

The Palanquin Ship was created by [[Hijiri Byakuren]] long before the events of [[Undefined Fantastic Object]]. It is a recreation of the ship [[Murasa Minamitsu]] once fell overboard from and drowned, allowing her to be saved by Byakuren. The crew is headed by Captain Murasa, other members including [[Kumoi Ichirin]], [[Nazrin]], and [[Toramaru Shou]]. An [[airship]], it is able to sail through the sky, and even cross into other realms of existence, such as [[Makai (Touhou)|Makai]].

Although both [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]] call it a "Flying Treasure Ship", once on board, they find the ship is empty. It eventually settled in [[Gensokyo]] near the Human Village and was temporarily a granary, before being converted into a Buddhist temple named Myouren-ji (命蓮寺), or [[Myouren Temple]], after [[Hijiri Myouren|Byakuren's brother]].

The ship is drawn from the story of the Flying Storage, or Soaring Vault (飛倉), from the "[i]Shigisan-engi[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigisan-engi.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Palanquin Ship":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Palanquin_Ship

title: raoh_(hokuto_no_ken)
body:
[b]Raoh[/b], also known by his self-proclaimed title [b]Ken-Oh[/b] ([b]拳王[/b], "Fist King"), is the main antagonist from [[Hokuto no Ken]].

He is the eldest of the four adopted children trained by Ryuken, the previous Hokuto Shinken master.

Raoh trained under Ryuken along with [[toki (hokuto no ken)|Toki]] and [[Kenshiro]], as well as another student named [[Jagi]]. In spite of his ambitions to become the greatest martial artist in the world, Raoh lost the rights to the Hokuto Shinken succession to Kenshiro. Refusing to give up the style, Raoh killed his sifu Ryuken in combat.

After the Nuclear War, Raoh has formed his own army made of various ruthless thugs and gang members, taking the name of Ken-Oh, King of Fist. Using his fearsome reputation and oppresive military and adminstrative tactics, Raoh managed to conquer the post-apocalyptic world with terror. Aimed to "seize the Heaven" by forcing several martial artists to gave up their style in order to take it for himself, thus making him the strongest of all fighters. He was later known as [b]The Conqueror of the Century's End[/b].

Raoh's hair and skin color often changes depending on the various medium he appeared in:

h4. Examples

* !post #3363451: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Parody (Manga color)]] 
* !post #654369: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Full armor (Toei)]] 
* !post #418388: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Full armor (2000 - 2005)]] 
* !post #548827: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Default (2000 - 2005)]] 
* !post #2953763: [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|Default (2006 Trilogy)]] 

* In the original manga, he has [[blonde hair]] and fair skin.

* In the 1984 anime, he has [[black hair]] and [[dark skin|brown skin]].

* In many video games, he has [[white hair]] and brown skin.

* In his later iterations since the 2006 [i]Hokuto no Ken[/i] trilogy movie, he has white hair and fair skin.

h4. Known moves

* 二指真空把 ([i]Nishi Shinku Ha[/i])
** An arrow shot towards the user is caught between two fingers and then deflected back towards the opponent.

* 北斗剛掌波 ([i]Hokuto Goshou Ha[/i])
** An aura blast Raoh tried to use against Kenshirou.

* 新血愁 ([i]Shinketsushuu[/i])
** A pressure point Raoh uses to cause his opponent's body to hemorrhage all of its blood for three days. [spoiler]This pressure point was the cause of Rei's death.[/spoiler]

* 無想転生 ([i]Musou Tensei[/i])
** The ultimate secret technique of Hokuto Shinken. It makes the user untouchable to all incoming attacks.

h4. See also

* [[I don't have a single regret in my life]]
* [[Kokuoh (hokuto no ken)|]]

title: stillsuit
body:
The [b]stillsuit[/b] is a special suit that first appeared in the [[science fiction]] novel [i][[dune_(series)|Dune]][/i] from 1965. It was created and is used by the [[Fremen]] who live in the [[desert]] [[planet]] Arrakis.

It is a special [[bodysuit|body-enclosing suit]] designed to collect and recycle all the moisture the body releases, from urine, feces and sweat, to the exhalation of [[water]] vapor in the breath.

The special fabric of the suit is a micro-sandwich designed to dissipate heat and filter wastes while reclaiming moisture. The water is then held in catchpockets and made available to drink through a tube.

A Fremen in a well-kept suit can survive weeks in the desert without any other source of water.

body:
Character from [[Granblue Fantasy]].

Element: Light
Rarity: SSR
Height: 157 cm

Introduced in the 10th anniversary event, [i]Heart of the Sun[/i], Raziel is an Archangel who used to work for Lucifer. She was tasked to investigate enigmas, which she would then record in her Sefer Raziel, the blue [[book|spellbook]] in her left hand. Sefer Raziel serves as a hammerspace from which she can pull any sort of resource she has recorded, and her favorite is a [[machine gun]] that she wields in her right hand.

Raziel has [[brown hair]] in [[low twintails|low]] [[twintails]] that fall over her shoulders, as well as [[blue eyes]]. Her proportions are rather full, with [[large breasts]] and firm [[thighs]]. Raziel wears a [[backless outfit|backless]] [[leotard]] with a [[showgirl skirt]] and [[pantyhose]], and her head is adorned with a [[hat]]. title: gogoplata
body:
A gogoplata is a type of [[choke_hold|chokehold]] also called Kagato-Jime in [[Judo]], that is used in grappling and was popularised by practitioners of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

The gogoplata is executed from a guard, commonly from a "rubber guard", where the legs are held very high against the opponent's upper back. The fighter then slips one foot in front of the opponent's head and under his chin, locks his hands behind the opponent's head, and chokes the opponent by pressing his shin or instep against the opponent's trachea. A variation called a Locoplata (popularized by Eddie Bravo) is when the practitioner uses his free foot to push up on the choking foot and increase pressure on the trachea.

Former [[WWE]] professional wrestler [[The Undertaker (wwe)|]] began using a variation of the move in January 2008 on SmackDown!, which would cause opponents to spit blood from their mouths. Former SmackDown! General Manager Vickie Guerrero (who was in the position at that time) would later kayfabe ban the move for the protection of the other wrestlers and strip The Undertaker of the World Heavyweight Championship as punishment for its use, an unprecedented move.

The move, now called the [I]Hell's Gate[/I], has since become one of The Undertaker's finishing moves.

title: dragon_sleeper
body:
A [[submission hold]] in [[wrestling]] where the attacking wrestler stands behind the opponent who is either sitting or lying face down, then pulls the opponent into an inverted facelock, often hooking the opponent's near arm with their free arm. The attacker then pulls backwards and up, wrenching the opponent's neck and spine. If the opponent is sitting, the wrestler can press their knee into the opponent's back, adding pressure. 

It is innovated by [[Fujinami Tatsumi]] and popularized in the United States by Ultimo Dragon. 

There are other variations of this hold:

1) With body scissors added to further restrain the opponent. Used by [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] wrestler [[Sanada (NJPW)|SANADA]] as the [i]Skull End[/i] and [[WWE]] wrestler Drew Gulak as the [i]Gu-Lock[/i].

2) A version from a back-mount position. In other words, a hybrid with a [[camel clutch]]. Used by Low Ki as the [i]Dragon Clutch[/i],  [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler Malakai Black as the [i]Owari Death Clutch[/i], [i]Dragon Slayer[/i] or [i]Dark Ritual[/i], and [[Tokyo Joshi Pro Wrestling]] wrestler Tatsumi Rika as the [I]White Dragon Sleeper[/I].

3) A standing variation. Used by [[The Undertaker (wwe)|]] as the [i]Takin' Care of Business[/i].

4) A transition from a [[surfboard (wrestling)|surfboard]] position. Used by All Elite Wrestling wrestler [[Daniel Bryan|Bryan Danielson]] as one of his signature moves.

title: ao_oni
body:
A Japanese survival horror game with RPG and puzzle elements, developed by [[noprops]] in 2008. The title is named after a folklore creature, the [[blue oni]].

Received an English translation by the early 2010s, and was adapted in various ways in the 2010s, including a novel and manga series written by Kuroda Kenji and illustrated by [[Suzuragi Karin]], a live action movie, and an anime by Studio DEEN.

Received two mobile-exclusive sequels in the late 2010s, Ao Oni 2 in 2016 and Ao Oni 3 in 2017 (which remains untranslated in English), as well as a mobile MMO called Ao Oni Online in 2018, all developed by GOODROID and published by UUUM through LiTMUS (who own the license for the Ao Oni property). 

h4. Characters

title: window_shutter
body:
A [[window]] covering, usually wooden, consisting of solid or louvered panels that provide security, protect against weather, and/or control the amount of sunlight that enters a room. Shutters may be mounted on the inside or outside of a window, and they may be fixed or hinged. Some shutters are purely aesthetic in design and may not cover the windows at all.

Contrast with [[window blinds]], which hang freely instead of being set in a frame.

Not to be confused with [[window shadow]], which are shadows created by a window.

h4. See Also
* [[curtains]]

title: liquid_metal_slime_(dq)
body:
Lit. "stray metal", also known as [i]liquid metal slime[/i].

A variant of the [[metal slime]] from the [[Dragon Quest]] series of RPGs, and a staple of the series.  Like Metal Slimes and Metal [[King Slime (dragon Quest)|]]s, Liquid Metal Slimes are a traditional level grinding target, allowing characters to gain mass levels -- if they can kill them.  Almost every game has had a spot where fighting metal slimes, including liquid metal slimes, is easy to do.

Liquid Metal Slimes are higher level than Metal Slimes, offering 40,000 (or just over 10,000 per character), approximately 10 times the experience of Metal Slimes.  Like metal slimes, they are completely immune to magic, take only 0-2 damage a hit from normal attacks, and run away very frequently.  They are otherwise unremarkable in combat.

A frequent subject of Anthropomorphizing, "Liquid Metal-Chan" (Hagure-chan) is depicted as a very [[athletic]] and [[flat chest|lithe]] [[exhibitionist]] with [[mirror]]-like chrome skin, [[streaking]] around wearing nothing but a pair of sneakers and a smile.  This is a reference to the shoes Liquid Metal Slimes drop in Dragon Quest 3 and Dragon Quest 9, which give experience just for being worn.

Previously translated in English as "Metal Babble" or "Metabble" depending on the game.

See also:  [[Slime (Dragon Quest)]]

title: metal_king

title: pi_(math)
body:
A number represented by the [b]𝜋[/b] symbol. It is the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter, roughly equal to 3.14159 (this number is infinite and non-repeating, or an irrational number). This means that a circle's circumference (the entire circle itself) is a little more than three times as long as its diameter (a straight line running through the circle).

h4. Pi and pi approximations 

* Pi: 3.14159265358979323846
* 22/7: 3.14285714285714285714

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]
* "Wikipedia: Pi":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pi]

title: clothed_after_sex
body: When a character is shown putting their clothes back on (e.g. post #1660407, post #2431121) or already fully dressed (e.g. post #1645318) but with some obvious clues that they've very recently had [[sex]] or [[masturbation|masturbated]]. Some common indicators are if they have [[cum]] [[cum in clothes|pooling inside their clothes]], or if they forgot to remove any [[stray pubic hair]]s. The character should have all of their clothes on or be at least mostly decent, to a level that they wouldn't have been during the actual sex act (i.e. there must have been [i]some[/i] effort to get their clothes back in place after they finished). In other words, if the character seemed to have had the piece of clothing on during sex (ex: an image of someone clothed lying unconscious right after sex), don’t add this tag. While this tag usually conflicts with [[clothed sex]], they [i]can[/i] be used together if the character is still shown fully clothed afterwards (e.g. post #1444869). h4. See also * [[although she hurriedly put on clothes (meme)|]] * [[implied after sex]] * [[clothed sex]] * [[adjusting clothes]] * [[disheveled]]

title: satsuki_(reverse:1999)
body:
Satsuki is a female character from [[Reverse:1999]]. Originally an orphan from the Taisho era(30 July 1912 to 25 December 1926), she used her Arcane skills to steal to survive before being arrested by government authorities and forced to wear special handcuffs to limit her Arcane skills. Eventually, she moved to Tokyo and works as a Cafe [[Wa Maid]].

She is voiced in both Japanese and English by [[Touyama Nao]], making her notable as the only playable character in Reverse:1999 to be voice by the same voice actor in two different languages.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6818283: Insight II: Reed Bloom

title: lord_el-melloi_ii_case_files
body:
A light novel series written by Sanda Makoto and illustrated by [[Sakamoto Mineji]]. Part of the [[Fate (series)|]] franchise.

This spin-off of the [[fate_(series)|Fate series]] is set between the events of [[Fate/Zero]] and [[Fate/stay night]]. It features the adventures of [[Lord El-Melloi II]] — a 30-something [[Waver Velvet]], now a lecturer at the Magus Association — as he and his 15-year-old assistant/apprentice [[gray (fate)|Gray]] investigate mysteries in the world of Thaumaturgy.

The novels are narrated in a style similar to [[Sherlock Holmes]] detective novels where Gray, much like [[john_hamish_watson|Watson]], serves as the main point-of-view character as she, a neophyte to the affairs of magi, steps into their dangerous society.

A manga adaptation debuted in Young Ace magazine in 2017, and an anime adaptation aired in 2019.

h4. Volumes

* [b]Case1.[/b] Adra Castle Separation.
* [b]Case2.[/b] Twin Form Tower (Upper).
* [b]Case3.[/b] Twin Form Tower (Lower).
* [b]Case4.[/b] Mystic Eyes collection train (Upper).
* [b]Case5.[/b] Mystic Eyes collection train (Lower).

h4. Main Characters

title: abigail_williams_(second_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Abigail Williams (fate)|]] in her Second Ascension form from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This form goes though a radical change from her default First Ascension, starting with the [[keyhole]] on her forehead, and her eyes changing from blue to red. Her normal black hat becomes a gigantic black [[witch hat]] with numerous black and orange bows plus some [[teddy bear|teddy bears]] decorating it. Her villager clothes are replaced with a series of [[black bow|black bows]] on strings that hang from more [[bow|bows]] around her neck. The strings barely manage to cover her breasts, and it's not certain if her in-game sprite has her wearing a [[black bra]] beneath them. The only lower body garment she wears is an extremely [[lowleg panties|low-cut]] pair of [[black panties]]. She wears black [[mary janes]], and a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her right leg that is lined with orange bows. She gains a pair of large black [[key|keys]] as her new weapons in this form, and the white tendrils she used to attack previously are now sinister [[tentacles]] that pop out of portals made by her keys.

Abigail's [[abigail williams (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]] adapts this basic design while adding more alien-like embellishments.

title: nike_dunk
body:
A basketball [[sneakers|sneaker]] produced by [[Nike (company)|]], sold in both high-top and low-top designs. Versions designed for [[skateboarding]] are released under the Nike SB line, though they share the same base design as the basketball version.

A limited-edition collab with [[Gundam Unicorn]] was released in 2021, and consisted of two high-top models based on the [[Unicorn Gundam]] and [[Unicorn Gundam Banshee]] (see post #4794034).

Closely resembles the [[Air Jordan 1]], but there are slight differences in the design. See below for a side-to-side comparison:
* !asset #19837005: Dunk on the left, Jordan 1 on the right

title: air_jordan_1
body:
The first [[Air Jordan]] [[sneakers|sneaker]] model, originally released in 1984. It has since become a staple of [[streetwear]] and [[hip hop]]-inspired fashion, and is a favorite of sneakerheads worldwide. As the first sneaker in the line, it is the only one to prominently feature the [[Nike (company)|]] swoosh as part of it's design.

The Chicago colorway saw a notable increase in popularity after being featured as part of [[Miles Morales]]' [[Spider-Man (miles morales)|]] costume in [[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse]].

Closely resembles the [[Nike Dunk]], but there are slight differences in the design. See below for a side-to-side comparison:
* !asset #19837005: Dunk on the left, Jordan 1 on the right

h4. External links

title: watashi_wa_succubus_ja_arimasen
body:
Watashi wa Succubus ja Arimasen (Eng: I could never be a succubus!) is a fantasy set ecchi comedy light novel series written by Kohigashi Nora and illustrated by [[Wasabi_(sekai)|]]. As of 2023 the series is up to 6 volumes.

The series follow the noble girl Lisalinde, known as Liz to her friends, who attends the Forst National Academy in Academy Town.  Liz at the start of the series is a second year high schooler having started as a first year, and is a well respected prim and proper lady with top grades.  Near the beginning of the school year, the hero's party arrives to attend school while two of their members recovers from battling the demon lord's generals.  Upon meeting the hero Cain, Liz is overcome with an extremely strong feeling and to her own shock she asks Cain for his underpants.  Thus begins Liz's struggles trying to maintain being a proper lady, while not knowing she's a recovering member of the hero's party that had lost her memories and powers over a year ago, and was known as being an extreme pervert whose powers came from her awakened succubus heritage.

h4. Characters - Main Cast

[[Lisalinde (watashi_wa_succubus_ja_arimasen)|]] (Protagonist)
[[Cain (watashi_wa_succubus_ja_arimasen)|]]
[[Melvy Ford Vass Russel]] 
[[Rachel (watashi_wa_succubus_ja_arimasen)|]]
[[Sylphonia (watashi_wa_succubus_ja_arimasen)|]] 

h4. Characters - Others

title: star_guardian_lux
body:
A [[magical girl]] [[official alternate costume|skin]] for [[Lux (league Of Legends)|]], released on May 18th, 2015. Her "dance emote":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4RPNbHIJiuA] comes from [i][[DokiDoki! Precure]][/i], and her recall animation is inspired by [[Sailor Moon]]'s original transformation sequence.

On September 19th, 2016, Riot announced a new set of magical girl skins for [i]League[/i] champions, revealing [[Jinx (League of Legends)|]], [[Janna (league Of Legends)|]], [[Lulu (League of Legends)|]] and [[Poppy (league of legends)|]] as Lux's teammates.

title: pentakill_olaf
body: After surviving what he believed was to be his final performance, [[olaf (league of legends)|Olaf]] sought to drink himself to death with the deadliest booze of Runeterra. He ended up in the depths of Zaun, drinking potent sump cocktails, bragging of glory days and daring chem-jacked thugs to take them on. Olaf soon found himself embroiled in underground golem fight-clubs. Up against chem-powered giants, Olaf found his natural talent for pounding drums was also good for pounding mechanical automatons to pieces.

title: popstar_ahri
body:
[i]The spotlights are on, the musicians are at the ready and the Spirit Rush is on. Popstar Ahri announces her presence, shooting a pulsing blue Spirit Orb across the stage. The notes surge from the speakers and seem to take on a life of their own around the pop darling. The crowd rushes the stage and Popstar Ahri charms the crowd with a night of song and dance.[/i]
- "Official Riot post at release":http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/skin-release/popstar-ahris-spirit-rush-tour-starts-today

Riot's official version of the [[Generation Ahri]] skin created by Korean fans, which was based on the [[Genie (song)|Genie]] naval uniform outfit and inspired by [[Ahri (league of legends)|]]'s dance emote being the dance from [i]Run Devil Run[/i] by [[Girls' Generation|Girls' Generation (SNSD)]]. It was released on November 25th, 2013 and priced at 975 Riot Points (RP), and its dance emote also uses the choreography from [i]Genie[/i].

h4. See also

* [[K/DA Ahri]]

title: luigi_(vacation)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Luigi]] introduced in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. Depicted wearing a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[striped shirt|striped]] [[green shirt|green]] [[Hawaiian shirt]] with [[buttons]] and [[short sleeves]] with a [[super mushroom]] [[mushroom print|print]] on it, along with a pair of [[white shorts]] and his usual [[shoes]]. Also lacks his usual hat and has on a pair of [[green-framed eyewear|green-framed]] [[sunglasses]]. Often depicted carrying a [[suitcase]].

title: luigi_(lederhosen)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Luigi]] introduced in [[Mario Kart Tour]] that puts him in [[German clothes]].  Depicted as wearing a [[brown overalls|brown]] [[lederhosen]] over a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[green shirt]] with [[buttons]] and [[long sleeves]] with [[white socks]] and an [[orange footwear|orange version]] of his usual [[shoes]]. Also has on a [[green hat]] with a [[hat feather]] in it and his usual [[white gloves]]. Often seen holding a [[fork]] with a [[sausage]] attached to it.

title: luigi_(golf)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Luigi]] throughout the [[Mario Golf]] series and in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. Depicted wearing a [[green shirt]] with a [[white collar]], [[short sleeves]], a [[zipper]] and a [[pocket]] along with [[white pants]], a [[blue belt]], [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]]. Also wears a [[green hat|green]] [[visor cap]] and a [[single glove|single]] [[white gloves|white glove]].

The [[Mario Kart Tour]] version has him wearing a pair of [[green overalls|green]] [[two-tone overalls|and]] [[white overalls|white]] [[vertical-striped overalls]] over a [[blue shirt]] with a [[star print]] on it. Also wears an [[orange footwear|orange]] version of his usual [[shoes]], his usual [[white gloves]], and a [[baseball cap]] that matches his overalls.

title: tennis_luigi
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Luigi]] throughout the [[Mario Tennis]] series. Depicted wearing a [[green shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], [[buttons]], and a [[white collar]], [[white shorts]], [[blue socks]] and [[green footwear|green]] [[sneakers]]. Also wears a [[green hat|green]] [[visor cap]] and his usual [[white gloves]].

title: penguin_luigi
body: An alternate form [[Luigi]] takes on when using the penguin suit. In this form, he wears a [[penguin costume]] complete with a [[grey hood]] and [[flippers]], and has on a pair of [[green overalls]] over it.

title: kitsune_luigi
body:
An alternate form [[Luigi]] takes on when wearing a tanuki suit. In this form, he wears a [[fox costume]], complete with a [[yellow hood]], [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[fox ears]], and a [[fake tail|fake]] [[fox tail]].

Not to be confused with [[Fox Luigi]].

title: fox_luigi
body:
An alternate form [[Luigi]] takes on when using the [[super leaf]]. In this form, he gains a pair of [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]].

Not to be confused with [[Kitsune Luigi]].

The game received a remake in 2020.

title: ice_luigi
body:
An alternate form [[Luigi]] gains when using an [[ice flower]]. It has two variations that appear:

In [[Super Mario Galaxy]], Luigi becomes effectively an [[ice sculpture]] version of himself.

In [[New Super Mario Bros. Wii]], Mario's [[shirt]] and [[cabbie hat]] [[blue shirt|become]] [[blue hat|blue]], and his [[overalls]] become [[green overalls|green]].

title: frog_luigi
body: An alternate form of [[Luigi]] when using the frog suit. In this form, Luigi wears a [[frog costume]] complete with a [[green hood|green]] [[frog hood]] and webbed feet.

title: flying_squirrel_luigi
body: An alternate form [[Luigi]] takes on when using the [[super acorn]]. In this form, his [[overalls]] become [[green overalls|green]] and his shirt becomes [[grey shirt|grey]] and has a notable [[turtleneck shirt|turtleneck]] to it. His usual hat also gains a pair of [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[squirrel ears]] and he also has a [[fake tail|fake]] [[squirrel tail]], as well as a membrane between his arms and his back reminiscent of real world flying squirrels. His shoes also become [[grey footwear|grey]], similar to his shirt.

title: fire_luigi
body: An alternate form of [[Luigi]] using the [[fire flower]]. In this form, Luigi's [[overalls]] become [[green overalls|green]] and his [[shirt]] and [[cabbie hat]] [[white hat|become]] [[white shirt|white]].

title: elephant_luigi
body: An alternate form of [[Luigi]] using the [[elephant fruit]] power-up. In this form, Luigi becomes a [[furry male|furry]] [[elephant boy]], complete with [[elephant ears|ears]] and [[elephant tail|tail]]. His sleeves are also noticeably shorter (though still [[long sleeves|long]]), and he [[no shoes|loses his shoes]].

title: dr._luigi
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Luigi]] in the [[Dr. Mario]] series, dressing him up as a [[doctor]]. Luigi wears a [[lab coat]] with a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[white pants]], and a [[green necktie]], and has a [[stethoscope]] around his neck. Notably, Luigi often retains his signature [[cabbie hat]], though several games do swap it out for the usual [[head mirror]] common to the series.

title: yuuri_(shoujo_shuumatsu_ryokou)
body:
One of the two main characters of [[Shoujo Shuumatsu Ryokou]], alongside [[chito_(shoujo_shuumatsu_ryokou)|Chito]]. She is impatient, selfish and energetic, caring more about food and other immediate pleasures than complex things like history or future planning. She is illiterate but a good marksman, often carrying a [[gun]].

She has [[long_hair|long]], [[messy_hair|messy]] [[blonde_hair|blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[blue_eyes|blue]] [[tareme]] eyes, and wears a [[Stahlhelm]] with her [[fur-trimmed_coat|furred]] winter [[military_uniform|military uniform]], composed of a [[green_coat|green coat]], [[black gloves]], [[green_pants|green pants]] and [[brown_footwear|brown shoes]].

title: segawa_onpu
body:
[[Ojamajo Doremi]] character.

A child idol with [[purple eyes]] who wears her [[purple hair]] in a [[side ponytail]] or a [[one side up]].

Usually wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] under a [[purple dress|purple]] [[pinafore dress]] with [[purple shorts]] underneath and [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[sneakers]].

Her purple-themed [[magical girl]] uniform consists of a [[dress]], [[purple footwear|purple]] [[knee boots]] with [[pointy footwear|pointy tips]], [[purple gloves]], a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[witch hat]] and [[earrings]].

[[roro (ojamajo doremi)|Roro]] is her fairy partner.

title: xan_(overman_king_gainer)
body: [[Xan (overman king gainer)|]] is a mysterious character from the series [[Overman King Gainer]] it does not appear in the anime or manga, but made an appearance as a secret and quite difficult boss in the special disc of [[Super Robot Wars Z1]]. His look is similar to the normal [[King Gainer]] but has a darker color scheme and is seen with a large sword as his main weapon.

title: ryoumen_sukuna_(true_form)_(jujutsu_kaisen)
body:
[[ryoumen sukuna (true form) (jujutsu kaisen)|Ryomen Sukuna's true form]] is first shown on chapter 3 of [[jujutsu_kaisen|Jujutsu Kaisen]], depicted as having [[extra_arms|extra arms]], [[extra_eyes|extra eyes]] and a [[stomach_mouth|stomach mouth]].
[[ryoumen_sukuna_(jujutsu_kaisen)|Sukuna]] would only fully realize his true form during the modern era [spoilers]after possessing [[fushiguro_megumi|Fushiguro Megumi]]'s body and transforming during his battle against [[kashimo_hajime|Kashimo Hajime]][/spoilers] on chapter 237.

Do not tag when [[ryoumen_sukuna_(jujutsu_kaisen)|Sukuna]] is possessing [[itadori_yuuji|Itadori Yuuji]]'s body, or when the form's key features are missing, specially the [[extra_eyes|extra eyes]] on the right side of his face. The main distinctions between [[ryoumen sukuna (true form) (jujutsu kaisen)|Ryomen Sukuna's true form]] and [[itadori_yuuji|Itadori Yuuji]]'s possession are his [[extra_arms|extra arms]], [[stomach_mouth|stomach mouth]], [[plug_(piercing)|plug earrings]], and mainly his overall size and hairstyle, [[ryoumen_sukuna_(jujutsu_kaisen)|Sukuna]]'s hair is wavier than [[itadori_yuuji|Yuuji]]'s [[spiked hair]].

h4. Examples
* Applies for the tag: post #7130314, post #5440169
* Does [b]not[/b] apply for the tag: post #6708643, post #4254398, post #4314392

title: flabebe
body:
[[Pokemon]] #669 in the National PokéDex, a Fairy-type Pokémon. 

It evolves into [[Floette]] starting at level 19, which evolves into [[Florges]] when exposed to a Shiny Stone. 

Flabébé is a small white Pokémon with green on its bottom half. It has white arms and long, notched ears, and a green tail. It has a rounded yellow "crown" on its head. It has beady eyes and blush marks, and a small nose. It is seen holding the pistil of a flower, which has petals that come in five colors: red, yellow, orange, blue, or white.

Japanese Name: [b]Flabebe[/b]

Forms:

* [[flabebe (red flower)|Flabébé (Red)]]
* [[flabebe (yellow flower)|Flabébé (Yellow)]]
* [[flabebe (orange flower)|Flabébé (Orange)]]
* [[flabebe (blue flower)|Flabébé (Blue)]]
* [[flabebe (white flower)|Flabébé (White)]]

Prior Pokémon: [[Pyroar]]
Next Pokémon: [[Floette]]

title: dogs_playing_poker
body:
A series of paintings by Cassius Marcellus Coolidge featuring anthromorphosized [[dog]]s, most of which having them seated at a [[playing card|card]] table while playing some sort of game. Arguably the best known and most parodied of the paintings is the one painted in 1903 titled [i]A Friend in Need[/i], depicting one dog trying to surreptitiously pass an ace to another using its hind paw.

h4. Further reading:
* "Wikipedia:  Dogs Playing Poker":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogs_Playing_Poker]
* "Arty: Why This Painting of Dogs Playing Poker Has Endured for over 100 Years":[https://www.artsy.net/article/artsy-editorial-painting-dogs-playing-poker-endured-100-years]

title: c-01_permit_(helldivers)
body:
A "breeding license" in the world of [[Helldivers (series)|]].

h5. Official lore 

The C-01 permit, or "Childhood Protection Document" is a document citizens of Super Earth must fill out before undertaking any action that could result in the birth of a child. The C-01 permit was first implemented in 2084 during the First Galactic War. 

The C-01 permit serves a means to ensure that every child in Super Earth has an opportunity to enjoy a safe, loving, and well educated childhood. In the past, unregulated parenthood frequently resulted in children being born into abusive, negligent, and unpatriotic families.

title: nunchaku
body:
Nunchaku, more commonly known as the "nunchucks", is a traditional East Asian [[weapon]] that consists of two sticks connected at their ends with a short chain or rope.

While often associated with Chinese and Okinawan martial arts, most long chained and small handle nunchaku were actually created in the Philippines, where they are called [b]Tabak-Toyok[/b] and are commonly known as [b]Chako[/b].  The Chako is often used as a street weapon in brawls.  The smaller size of the Tabak-Toyok allows for easy concealment and everyday carry.  The weapon is best used at long-range.

This small handle type of nunchaku is more often used for quick and multiple strikes than grips or holds (like its Chinese and Japanese counterparts), and was popularized by [[Bruce Lee]] after he was introduced to them by his Flilipino fellow martial artist and friend, Dan Inosanto.

Not to be confused with [[three section staff]].

h4. See also

* [[flail]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: cocking_gun
body:
A general term for a variety of actions used to chamber/prime [[gun]]s before firing them. This may include:
* Manually pulling back the hammer of a [[revolver]]
* Racking the slide of a semi-automatic [[handgun]]
* Racking the slide of a [[pump action]] shotgun
* Cycling the bolt of a [[bolt action]] rifle

Usually performed after loading a [[magazine_(weapon)|magazine]] to chamber the first round, but can also forcibly remove an existing round or clear a jam. May also depict a [[handgun]] slide being forced back during normal operation for dramatic effect.

h4. See Also
* [[locked slide]]

title: renee_lemaire
body:
[b]Renée Bernadette Émilie Lemaire[/b] (1914-1944) was a [[real life]] [[belgium|Belgian]] [[nurse]] from [[World War II]] who along with Congolese nurse "Augusta Chiwy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Augusta_Chiwy, took care of many wounded [[United States]] [[soldier]]s during the [[Battle of the Bulge]]. She appears in the [[Band of Brothers]] HBO miniseries. 

For their actions Lemaire and Chiwy are often called [i]"The Angels of Bastogne"[/i].

[spoilers]Renée was killed during a German [[Luftwaffe]] air raid on [[Christmas]] Eve in 1944 during the [[Siege of Bastogne]].[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Eugene Roe]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia page":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ren%C3%A9e_Lemaire

body:
A [[Hololive]] semi-official [[virtual YouTuber]] unit. 

Kanata established the name shortly after the three decided to start renting a sharehouse together (同居 [i]doukyo[/i] is Japanese for "living together", as in a sharing a house). This arrangement later grew to include Suisei's sister [[Anemachi]], although she's not a Hololive member or a Vtuber in her own right; Coco also continues to live in the Doukyo's sharehouse despite her retirement from Hololive in July 2021.

[u]Use this tag when:[/u]
* The image mentions the name "Doukyo's/同居ーず, and/or
* All three of the members are grouped together, regardless of Coco's graduation.
** May also include Anemachi.

h4. See also
* [[List of hololive units and subgroups]]

title: devil_fruit
body:
A mysterious fruit that grants superpowers at the expense of the ability to swim in the world of [[One Piece]]. They come in three basic types, are typically covered in swirly lines and they all taste awful.

Their powers are unique and only one user of the same power exists at the same time. Eating more than one fruit is considered fatal, thus no one can have more than one power (the only exception being [[Marshall D. Teach]] for some unknown reason) The fruits "respawn" after the user dies.

[b]Logia Type:[/b]
Elemental type, allows the user to turn into and control a certain "element" such as Fire, Smoke or Mud.

[b]Zoan Type:[/b]
Animal type, allows the user to transform into a certain animal (including humans) as well as intermediate forms. Also exists in Ancient- (extinct) and Mythological types. Can have additional powers depending on the animal type.

[[Dr. Vegapunk]]'s research has created a method to "feed" zoan type fruits to in-animate objects as well as a method to create artificial zoan fruits.

[b]Paramecia Type:[/b]
The most varied form of devil fruit, as all powers that don't fit into the above types are considered paramecia.

title: beer_hat
body:
A beer hat or "beer helmet" is a a [[hat]], usually a [[baseball cap]], that features holders on both sides to hold a [[can]] of beer.  Long straws from the cans allow the wearer to drink from them.

The cans can be drinks other than beer, a frequent alternative is [[soda]].

One such hat was featured in the [[Spongebob Squarepants (series)|]] episode "One Krabs Trash".

title: implied_futanari
body:
When a character in the image seems to be a [[futanari]], but it's not 100% certain.
Signs of futanari include intercourse with a [[stomach bulge]] and [[cum]], [[condom wrapper]]s or penetrative sex positions with thrusting and sex noises.

Whether the character is canonically a futanari or not, whether related pictures have a penis showing or not, and whether the artist clarifies that it is futanari or not aren't relevant. So long as it cannot be confirmed visually, this tag can be used.

This tag can overlap with [[futanari]] for the sake of usability and blacklisting, due to tags like [[futa with female]]/[[futa with male]].

For a comprehensive guide on how to use this tag, see forum #272717.

h4. See also
* [[implied yuri]]
* [[implied yaoi]]
* [[implied bisexual]]
* [[implied sex]]

title: jules_bianchi
body:
Jules Lucien André Bianchi (3 August 1989 – 17 July 2015) was a French motor racing driver who drove for the Marussia F1 Team in Formula One.

Bianchi had previously raced in Formula Renault 3.5, GP2 and Formula Three and was a Ferrari Driver Academy member. He entered Formula One as a practice driver in 2012 for Sahara Force India. In 2013, he made his debut driving for Marussia, finishing 15th in his opening race in Australia and ended the season in 19th position without having scored any points. His best result that year was 13th at the Malaysian Grand Prix. In October 2013, the team confirmed that he would drive for the team the following season. In the 2014 season, he scored both his and the Marussia team's first points in Formula One at the Monaco Grand Prix

On 5 October 2014, during the Japanese Grand Prix, Bianchi lost control of his Marussia in very wet conditions and collided with a recovery vehicle, suffering a diffuse axonal injury He underwent emergency surgery and was placed into an induced coma, and remained comatose until his death on 17 July 2015 Bianchi's death was the first to result from an on-track incident in Formula One in over 20 years, after Ayrton Senna's fatal accident at the 1994 San Marino Grand Prix.

title: andy_seto
body: Andy Seto is a Chinese comic artist who specializes in martial-arts based stories. He's well known for his work on comic adaptations of King of Fighters and Biohazard game-universes, and his main series, "Cyber Weapon Z." He has also drawn a graphic novel adaptation of the earlier Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon novels, the King of Fighters series, and also created a graphic novelization of Stephen Chow's film, Shaolin Soccer. His other work includes: Saint Legend, a story about the Eight Taoist Immortals, Story of The Tao, Dog Story, Para Para, The Four Constables, and Sword Kill. Seto's art style is mixing both manga and western art.

title: jenova
body:
The "Calamity from the skies" in [[Final Fantasy VII]], Jenova is an [[alien|extraterrestrial]] life-form of an unnamed species that landed on the planet of Gaia two thousand years ago.  30 years before the game begins, [[Gast Faremis]] exhumed the dormant alien's remains and named it Jenova, mistaking it for one of the ancient race known as the Cetra.  Jenova's cells were eventually used in ShinRa Company's super-soldier program, resulting in the creation of [[Sephiroth]] and other SOLDIERs.

Though genderless, Jenova manifests itself as a [[nude]] feminine entity with [[blue skin|blue]] or [[grey skin]] and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], with [[parted bangs|hair parted down the middle]] and [[one-eyed|one]] [[glowing eye|glowing]] [[red eyes|red eye]].

title: hizuki_miu
body:
[[Indie virtual YouTuber|Independent]] [[virtual youtuber]]. Former member from [[WACTOR production|WACTOR]]'s first unit "Mirais".

h4. Appearance

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair|grey]] hair arranged in a [[side ponytail]] with a [[green bow|green]] [[hair bow]] or [[hair ribbon]]. Often wears [[cat ears]] or a [[triangle hair ornament]].

As an indie, she has white [[medium hair]], with [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[colored inner hair]].

h4. Costumes

1st and 2nd costumes designed by [[Takehana Note]]; 3rd one by [[Toma_(norishio)|Coburina Toma]]; 4th one by [[touyou_(39kir)|Touyou]].

Her first outfit (post #5032455), consists of a [[white shirt|white]] and [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], white [[arm warmers]], and [[white thighhighs]].

Her second outfit (post #4853524) consists of a white [[collared shirt]] with [[triangle print|triangle prints]], a [[multicolored vest|multicolored]] [[green_vest|green]] and [[black vest]] with [[gold trim|gold trims]], a [[green necktie]] with a [[triangle]] ornament, a black pleated skirt, and white thighhighs and a [[thigh strap]].

Her third outfit (post #4957620) consists of an [[aqua jacket|aqua]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[frilled jacket|frills]], [[puffy long sleeves]] and a [[hooded jacket|hood]], a [[black sports bra]], [[black panties|black]] [[highleg panties]], [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]], [[aqua thighhighs]] and [[aqua footwear|aqua]] [[sneakers]].

Her fourth outfit (post #7369239) consists of an [[aqua shirt|aqua]] [[cropped shirt]], an [[aqua jacket|aqua]] [[cropped jacket]], a [[white skirt]] wih a [[black belt]], worn over a [[white one-piece swimsuit]]. She also wears [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].

h4. External links

* "YouTube":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCM6iy_rSgSMbFjx10Z6VVGA

title: penny_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Penny[/b], known as [b]Botan[/b] (ボタン) in Japan, is one of the rivals  in [[Pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]].

Originally from the Galar region, Penny is a shy girl in the same grade as the protagonist who is apparently good with machines and computers. She appears several times in the Starfell Street storyline serving as Cassiopeia's supply unit rep. The box legendary seems fond of licking her. 
She is very fond of the Pokémon [[Eevee]] may evolve into, which she refers to as "Veevees".

[spoiler] It is eventually revealed that she is the true identity of Cassiopeia, forming [[Team Star]] in a response to being bullied at the academy. Her true personality is sarcastic and often brusque, but she cares for her friends dearly.[/spoiler]

h4. Official art

* !post #5560181: [[Penny (pokemon)|Default]]

body:

Due to her feeling that she does not have a proper friend and rival to bond with [spoiler]after becoming the champion of the Paldea region[/spoiler], she approached the newcomer (i.e. the protagonist) to be her rival. She is a kind and friendly girl who likes to encourage others, but her lack of social tact plus her obssession with Pokemon battles often puts other people off. title: larry_(pokemon)
body:
The Gym Leader of Medali's Gym, as well as a member of Elite Four of the Paldea region from [[Pokemon SV|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]]. He is specialized in Normal-type pokémon, but is forced to use Flying-type by his boss [[Geeta (pokemon)|]] as an Elite Four, much to his disdain. Known as [b]Aoki[/b] in Japan.

An extremely stoic [[salaryman]], Larry stands out from the rest of the SV casts for his plain and simple design, his "no nonsense" attitude, and a frequent jab on the Japanese work culture (particularly on his [[Geeta (pokemon)|boss]]). Because of this, he gained a cult fanbase following in the process.

h4. Official art

body:
The first game in the [[Mass Effect (series)|]] series.

The game takes place within the Milky Way galaxy in the year 2183, where civilization is threatened by a highly advanced machine race known as the Reapers. The player controls [[Commander Shepard]], an elite human soldier who must stop a rogue agent from carrying out the Reapers' galactic invasion.

h4. Characters

* [[Commander Shepard]]
* [[Ashley Williams]]
* [[Garrus Vakarian]]
* [[Kaidan Alenko]]
* [[Liara T'soni]]
* [[Tali'Zorah]]
* [[Urdnot Wrex]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mass Effect":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_Effect_(video_game)]
* "Mass Effect Wiki":[https://masseffect.fandom.com/wiki/Mass_Effect_Wiki]

title: arven_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Arven,[/b] known as [b]Pepper[/b] (ペパー) in Japan, is one of the rivals in [[Pokemon SV]].

He is the character that gifts the protagonist [[Koraidon]] or [[Miraidon]], as well as the main character of the Path of Legends storyline. Initially standoffish and quick to anger, Arven warms up to the protagonist over the game and eventually reveals that [spoiler] he is searching for the Herba Mystica in order to heal his [[Mabosstiff]], who has sustained a grevious injury.[/spoiler]

He is the son of the game's professor, [[Sada (Pokemon)|Sada]] in Scarlet or [[Turo (Pokemon)|Turo]] in Violet.

h4. Official art

* !post #5561540: [[Arven (pokemon)|Default]]

h4. External links

title: quality_cabbage_(meme)
body:
A [[parody]] [[meme]] spawned by a particularly [[QUALITY]] rendition of a [[cabbage]] amongst the generally QUALITY artwork of the [i][[Yoake Mae Yori Ruri Iro Na]][/i] anime when it was originally broadcast on TV. The "cabbage" in question is a featureless green [[sphere]] that in no way resembles an actual cabbage. However, this was later corrected in the video release of the anime.

* !post #135252: [[quality cabbage (meme)|Comparison between the original "QUALITY" scene (including the cabbage) and the revision.]]  

A similar "cabbage" in artwork for other series is almost certainly a parody of the Yoake Mae Yori Ruri Iro Na scene and should receive this tag.

title: gesugao
body:
An expression where a character is shown with a condescending, menacing, and sinister look. Often shown with an [[evil smile]], [[smirk]], or [[sneer]], giving them a sense of sheer disdain or superiority towards the viewer or other characters.

Usually used with a normal/nice character, to show an [[out of character]] moment. But can also applied to a character who canonically has such a face or using it to emphasize their evil side (particularity when said character is betraying the protagonist), so that the viewer would feel a sense of satisfaction when these character were defeated.

Might overlap with [[yandere]]. Although there's no need for  violence to be shown, only the expression.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

body:

Named for Azuchi Castle (安土城, Azuchi-jō), one of the primary castles of [[Oda Nobunaga]] constructed from 1576 to 1579 and demolished in 1582 by Akechi Mitsuhide. It was located on the shores of Lake Biwa in Ōmi Province.

title: dj_octavio
body:
Main antagonist of [[Splatoon (series)|]]. Named [b]DJ Takowasa[/b] in the Japanese version.

The leader of the [[Octarian (enemy)|]]s, Octavio rides around in a electronic music-themed flying fortress while using [[turntable]]s to attack. He is a very loud and boisterous character. In the American English version, he tends to make EDM-related puns while attacking.

He wears a golden octopus-shaped [[kabuto (helmet)|]] on his head.

According to a Sunken Sea Scroll (post #2116111), Octavio used to be friends with a younger [[Cap'n Cuttlefish]].

title: turbocharger
body:
An [[engine]] component that uses the flow of exhaust gasses to compress intake air, which forces more air into the engine and produces more power. Turbos are sometimes offered as a factory component on certain [[car]]s and [[truck]]s, but are also a very popular aftermarket attachment to increase a vehicle's horsepower.

Sometimes colloquially referred to as a "snail" due to its spiral shape.

h4. Examples
* !asset #19761977: A turbocharger
* !asset #19772295: A turbocharger as it appears when installed in an [[engine]]

title: racing_miku_(2013)
body:
The 2013 version of [[Racing Miku]], designed by Mari Shimazaki, illustration by [[Saitou Masatsugu]].

[b][[Race Queen]][/b]
She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair]] in [[twintails]].
She wears a [[white leotard]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[aqua necktie]]. She wears [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]]. 
She wears a small [[crown]] tipped to the side. Not to be confused with the [[racing miku (2015)|2015]] version that wears a larger crown/tiara. 

[b][[racing_miku_(2013_Sepang_ver.)|Swimsuit version]][/b]
She wears a [[white bikini]] with [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear_on_head|on her head]] and [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. Her hair is in a [[double bun]] shaped like [[heart hair bun|hearts]]. 
She often has [[mechanical wings]].


[b]EV MIRAI version[/b]
She wears a [[bikesuit]], usually [[unzipped]], with a [[grey sports bra|grey]] [[sports bra]] and [[gloves]]. She wears [[star_hair_ornament|star hair ornaments]].

h4. Official Art

title: fluffed_up
body:
When a character is rendered fluffier than their "default state". This can be external due to factors such as being blow dried or static electricity post #2715406 post #5862716 or voluntary like an animal puffing up to keep warm.

Distinct from [[fluffy]] in that this is a temporary state while fluffy is just physical appearance regardless of whether or not the character is always fluffy. Though the two often overlap.

title: wariza
body:
[b]Wariza[/b] (割座), also known as "w-sitting" or "reverse tailor style sitting" in English, is a [[sitting]] posture whereby the butt is on the floor and the legs are bent backwards on each side of the body. It is the traditional informal sitting style for Japanese women. If the legs are folded out to only one side, then it is called [[yokozuwari]].

The other Japanese names are: 女の子座り ([i]onna-no-ko-zuwari[/i], girl's sitting), アヒル座り ([i]ahiru-zuwari[/i], duck sitting) or ぺたん座り ([i]petan-zuwari[/i], flat surface sitting). (In fact, in Japanese, [i]wariza[/i] more commonly refers to a yoga pose.)

h4. Examples
* !post #5614038
* !post #5556415

h4. See also

* [[sitting]]
* [[seiza]]
* [[yokozuwari]]
* [[Tag Group:Posture]]

title: reml
body:
[[Denonbu]] character and a member of Shin-Shinjuku GR School's electronic music club.

She has [[curly hair|curly]] [[black hair|black]] [[twintails|twin tail]] hair and [[pink eyes]].

She's seen wearing a [[purple dress|purple]] and pink girlish dress with white [[frills]]. She is also wearing thick-soled [[shoes]] and carrying a pink [[backpack]].

Almost all her accessories are pink in color, and she is wearing a black catsuit shaped like [[horns]].

Her character is inspired by [[jirai kei]] subculture in Japan.

title: ogami_matoi
body:
[[Denonbu]] character and a member of Shin-Shinjuku GR School's [[denonbu|electronic music club]]. 

She has light [[blue eyes]] and wolf-cut dark [[brown hair]] in an arrangement reminiscent of [[animal ears]].

She is seen wearing a [[navel]]-baring [[hoodie]]. [[long sleeves|Sleeves]] are arranged in Japanese style with zipper cutouts at the elbows. She also wears [[shorts]] to which [[headphones]] can be attached.

Clothing and accessories in the basic color of green with red, white and black color inserts reminds somewhat of the colors of the kabuki curtain.

h4. Official art

* !post #5658531

title: abeno-shakuji-maya
body:
[[Denonbu]] character and a member of Shin-Shinjuku GR School's electronic music club.

She has [[long hair|long]] and [[grey hair]], and [[black eyes]]. And her skin is [[dark skin|slightly black]].

She is seen wearing a customized black [[serafuku]] based on that of the Heisei period. For example, her [[green socks]] are probably a type of [[loose socks]], albeit extreme.

She wears a black [[obi]], a vermilion [[obijime]] and a black [[fox mask]]. In addition, her [[long sleeves|sleeves]] are decorated with vermilion cherry blossom motifs. Besides, the fox mask gives off a suspicious scent.

She has [[bandages]] on her neck and thighs.

h4. Official art

* !post #5658522

title: taiga_lucia
body:
[[Denonbu]] character and a member of Teion International High School's [[denonbu|electronic music club]] in Shibuya area. 

Lucia has [[short hair|short]] bright [[blonde hair]] with tufts on either side with white tips that almost appear to be shaped like [[animal ears]]. She has yellow-[[green eyes]].

She wears a white cropped [[jacket]] with a [[fur-trimmed hood|fur-trimmed]] [[hood]]. There is a large white [[zipper]] in the middle, as well as one on each arm. There are black and yellow stripes on her jacket. The chest [[pocket]] features a red triangle. She wears [[black shorts]] with yellow triangle accents, paired with a large green zipper shaped [[belt]].

Lucia has two yellow [[plaster]]s on her right knee in a cross shape. She wears yellow crew [[socks]] underneath black [[boots]] with yellow soles and white buckles, which also feature red triangles.

h4. Official art

* !post #5658361

title: haijima_ginka
body:
[[Denonbu]] character and a member of Minato Shirokane Girls' High School's electronic music club in Azabu area. 

Ginka has [[grey hair]] and [[green eyes]], along with a [[mole]] under her lip.

She is seen wearing a white [[dress shirt]] with a heart-shaped window. Her [[jacket]] is black with red [[striped|stripes]], and she wears grey [[dress pants]].

Accessories she wears include silverware fork and knife [[earrings]], a pair of black ankle high [[socks]], a [[green necktie]] and [[pin]]s with references to 80's related aesthetics.

h4. Official art

* !post #5658343

title: shirokane_aki
body:
[[Denonbu]] character and the president of Minato Shirokane Girls' High School's electronic music club in Azabu area. 

Aki has golden [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]].

She's seen wearing a [[sleeveless]] white [[turtleneck]], that's strapped in by a [[black corset]] with golden [[chain]]s, along with a [[grey skirt]] with black [[rose]] patterns. Her [[jacket]] is also grey but features a design inside which are golden colored [[sparkle]]s.

Accessories she wears are: A black thigh [[belt]], a [[bracelet]], [[black thighhighs]] with black zig zag stripes, a [[black headband]] with gold [[dollar sign]]s on it, one golden chain and one [[necklace]] with a red [[gem]] on it.

h4. Official art

title: inubousaki_shian
body:
[[Denonbu]] character and a member of Jingumae Sandou High School’s electronic music club in Harajuku area. 

Shian has dark [[purple hair]] and dark [[purple eyes]]. In some art, notably the chibi artwork, she's seen having [[sharp teeth|shark-like teeth]].

She's seen wearing a huge [[purple hoodie]] that's closed up with heart styled [[buttons]]. The hoodie itself has images of [[pill|pills]] and [[candy]], along with that, in the middle end there's a [[Torii]] which is likely in reference to her Shrine maiden background.

Her attire as a [[miko|shrine maiden]] is a [[white kimono]] called hakue, and a purple [[hakama]].

Shian's legs are decorated with [[bandaid|band-aids]] and her [[phone]] has a phone case, along with strap accessories, that match her color palette and overall aesthetic.

h4. Official art

* !post #5657737

title: sakurano_mimito
body:
[[Denonbu]] character, the club president and center of Jingumae Sandou High School's electronic music club in Harajuku area. 

Mimito has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|peach hair]]. It was previously [[long hair|long]] and tied into [[twintails]]. She also has [[pink eyes]].

She is seen wearing a [[pink hoodie]] with a [[heart pattern]] which also features white and purple, a [[black skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]].

body:
[[Denonbu]] character and a member of Jingumae Sandou High School's [[denonbu|electronic music club]] in Harajuku area. 

Hina has [[white hair]] with [[blue eyes]] with some accents of orange.

She's seen wearing a [[serafuku]] styled [[dress]] with turquoise, along the corner, there's some [[paint splatter|splats of orange and blue]]. It can be noted that she doesn't, unknowingly or on purpose, tie the front part of the serafuku style dress correctly, as one side is fine while the other is longer and wrinkled.

Accessories seen on her mainly are: [[safety pin]]s, leather [[bracelet|bracelets]], a black [[beret]] along with a [[hair pin]] that also resembles a safety pin. title: kayano_futaba
body:

She has [[blonde hair]], which is tied into low pony tails, and [[orange eyes]].

Futaba, much like the other girls in the club, wears the [[school uniform]].

However, just like the other members of the club, she wears a [[hoodie]], which is wrapped around her waist. Her hoodie is mainly [[green hoodie|green]] with pink, black and white details.

Accessory-wise, she has [[hair tie|hair ties]] which match her hoodie, a [[green scrunchie]] around her wrist, and dark thigh-high [[stockings]].

When she enters "Idol-mode", her hairstyle changes to [[twintails]] and the hair decorations on her hair increase and become star-shaped.

title: maria_marionette_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Maria Marionette]], as seen in post #5528211. 

Her default ILUNA [[school uniform]] is composed of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[black shirt|black]] [[dress shirt]] with a [[pink bowtie]] underneath a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]] attached with several [[brooch]]es. Her shirt is also [[shirt tucked in|tucked]] under a [[black corset]], tied by a pair of [[black belt]]s, and a [[checkered skirt|checkered]] [[brown skirt|brown]] [[multicolored clothes|and]] [[black skirt]]. She also wears a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[fishnet gloves]], a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]] and a pair of [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] thighhighs. The left one is a [[striped legwear|horizontal-striped]] [[black thighhighs|black]] and [[purple thighhighs|purple]], while the right one is a [[vertical-striped legwear|vertical-striped]] [[black]] one, each of them are also pulled by a [[garter straps|garter strap]].

title: thread_snips
body:
Thread snips are small, normally spring-loaded, [[scissors]] used for trimming threads.  Their small size, about 4 inches (~10 cm) makes them easy to keep close to the sewing machine for quick access to trim the end of seams.  They're also known as thread nippers, thread clippers, and thread cutters.

Unlike common scissors featuring the hinge in the middle, thread snips have the hinge in the end opposite the blades.

h4. Examples

* !post #6046753: Modern style, toward bottom left
* !post #6034126: Modern style, near table corner
* !post #1259306: Older style, on left and right sides

title: zaku
body:
A type of [[mobile suit]] [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] [[military]] [[science fiction]] franchise. It is one of the most recognizable and iconic mobile suits of the franchise, often used by [[zeon]], the enemies of the Gundam pilots. The most common version of the Zaku is the [[Zaku II]].

The zaku is usually green with a single eye. It may have spikes on one shoulder and a [[shield]] on the other. It may also have hoses on the head, waist, and legs.

Originating from the Universal Century timeline, the Zaku has appeared in different Alternate Universes including [[Turn A Gundam]]'s Correct Century as the [[Borjarnon]] and [[Gundam SEED Destiny]]'s Cosmic Era as the [[ZAKU Warrior]] and ZAKU Phantom. 

This tag refers to a type of visibly similar mecha from the gundam universe and therefore should NOT be used as a character tag.

title: pokemon_bw_(anime)
body:
The fourth series of the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]] and is based on the events of the Generation V core series Pokémon games. It follows [[pokemon dppt (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Diamond and Pearl]] and was succeeded by [[pokemon xy (anime)|Pokémon the Series: XY]]. It ran from September 23, 2010 to October 3, 2013 (with a special episode on March 27, 2014) in Japan and from February 12, 2011 to December 7, 2013 in the United States.

As with both [[pokemon rse (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Ruby and Sapphire]] and Pokémon the Series: Diamond and Pearl before it, Pokémon the Series: Black & White begins with only [[Ash Ketchum]], who sets out to travel through the Unova region and challenge the Unova League with his [[Pikachu]], accompanied by a girl by the name of [[Iris (pokemon)|]] and with one of the first Unova Gym Leaders, [[Cilan (pokemon)|]], who is also a Pokémon Connoisseur.

title: pokemon_rse_(anime)
body:
The second series of the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]] and is based on the events of the core series Generation III Pokémon games. It follows the [[pokemon (classic anime)|original series]] and was succeeded by [[pokemon dppt (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Diamond and Pearl]]. It ran from November 21, 2002 to September 14, 2006 in Japan and from November 1, 2003 to March 3, 2007 in the United States

In this series, [[ash ketchum|Ash]] travels through the Hoenn region in an effort to compete in the Hoenn League there. He is joined not by [[Misty (pokemon)|]], who had been his continuous companion for the entirety of the original series, but [[May (pokemon)|]], a rookie Trainer from Petalburg City who at first merely wishes to travel. Eventually, she learns of Pokémon Contests and declares herself a Pokémon Coordinator, training to win Ribbons so she can enter the Hoenn Grand Festival. May's brother, [[Max (pokemon)|]], also travels with the group and helps map out routes to take using his [[pokenav|PokéNav]]. However, Max is too young to have his own Pokémon. [[Brock (pokemon)|]], Ash's near-constant adviser, returns soon after the start of the series.

title: pokemon_xy_(anime)
body:
The fifth series of the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]] and is based on the events of the Generation VI core series Pokémon games. It follows [[pokemon bw (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Black & White]] and was succeeded by [[pokemon sm (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Sun & Moon]]. It ran from October 17, 2013 to November 10, 2016 in Japan and from January 18, 2014 to January 28, 2017 in the United States.

As with the previous three series, Pokémon the Series: XY began with only [[Ash Ketchum]], headed off to Kalos region with his [[Pikachu]], intending to challenge the Kalos League. Joining him this time are [[Serena (pokemon)|]], a new Trainer who previously met Ash in her childhood; [[Clemont (pokemon)|]], an aspiring inventor and scientist, who is also the Gym Leader of the Lumiose Gym; and [[Bonnie (pokemon)|]], Clemont's younger sister.

title: pokemon_dppt_(anime)
body:
The third series of the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]] and is based on the events of the Generation IV core series Pokémon games. It follows [[pokemon rse (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Ruby and Sapphire]] and was succeeded by [[pokemon bw (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Black & White]]. It ran from September 28, 2006 to September 9, 2010 in Japan and from June 4, 2007 to February 5, 2011 in the United States.

Like the previous series, this series begins with [[Ash Ketchum]] beginning his journey by himself, this time through the Sinnoh region, aiming to conquer the Sinnoh League. His longtime companion [[Brock (pokemon)|]] eventually rejoins him, as does [[Dawn (pokemon)|]], a rookie Pokémon Coordinator from [[Twinleaf Town]] who wishes to follow in the footsteps of [[johanna (pokemon)|her mother]] and gain the title of Top Coordinator.

title: pokemon_(classic_anime)
body:
The first series of the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]] and is based on the events of the core series Generation I and II Pokémon games, respectively. It was succeeded by [[pokemon rse (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Ruby and Sapphire]]. It ran from April 1, 1997 to November 14, 2002 in Japan and from September 7, 1998 to October 25, 2003 in the United States.

During the original series, rookie Trainer [[Ash Ketchum]] begins his journey in the Kanto region, leaving his home of [[Pallet Town]] with the only first partner Pokémon that [[samuel oak|Professor Oak]] had left to give: a reluctant and moody [[Pikachu]]. Ash's quest begins in earnest to defeat all of the Gym Leaders and get to the Pokémon League as soon as he has gained Pikachu's trust, and he is joined by two mentors, [[Misty (pokemon)|]] and [[Brock (pokemon)|]].

title: harpy
body:
A [[monster girl]] usually based on birds, though some examples are dinosaur girls or other mythological creatures.

Harpies have [[winged arms|wings instead of arms]] or at least heavily feathered arms alongside wings (see post #6477937) and claws instead of feet (see post #613745). Some may only have feathered body parts (post #646639).

A traditional harpy will instead have the body of a bird but the head of a woman (post #2431167).

h4. Examples

* !post #5657281: Papi, the most common modern harpy style
* !post #6191440: Another common modern style
* !post #6818038: A more Traditional Harpy

title: lady_jessica
body:
[b]Lady Jessica[/b] is a fictional character from the [[DUNE (series)|]] novel series. She is the concubine of Duke [[Leto Atreides]] and the mother of his son and heir, [[Paul Atreides]]. Despite her status as a concubine, she is treated as the Duke's wife due to the couple's love for each other. As a member of the [[Bene Gesserit]], a religious order of nuns with powers, she possesses mind controlling powers using her voice, and knows the "weirding way" of [[martial arts]] combat.

The character has been played by several actresses in live action: [[Francesca Annis]] in the 1984 Dune movie, Saskia Reeves in the 2000 Dune miniseries, Alice Krige in the 2003 Children of Dune miniseries and "Rebecca Ferguson":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rebecca_Ferguson in [[dune (2021 movie)|the 2021 Dune movie by Denis Villeneuve]].

title: flower_(vocaloid)
body:
flower is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by the YAMAHA Corporation in collaboration with Gynoid Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine. She later received a [[Gynoid Talk]] bank. In July 2020 it was announced that flower's next voicebank would be on the [[CeVIO]] engine.

Her first appearance was designed by [[10xxx05|Rokoru]] and illustrated by [[yamako (state of children)|Yamako]]. With an entire purple theme, she wears a [[purple dress|dress]], [[choker]], [[vest]], [[arm warmers|arm warmer]], [[thighhighs]], [[boots]]. Her hair is light [[purple hair|purple]] as well as her [[purple eyes|eyes]]. Her [[flower (vocaloid4)|second appearance]] by [[miwasiba|△○□×]] holds similar, just with [[short hair|shorter hair]] and [[shorts]].

title: motorized_kick_scooter
body:
A small motorized vehicle similar to a [[kick scooter]] that is composed of a wheeled board which the rider stands on and a handlebar that the rider uses to steer the vehicle.

E-scooters (electric motorized scooters) have become the dominate type of motorized scooter since the 2000's, especially with the rise of scooter sharing services in major cities.

For the larger motor scooter road vehicle which the rider would sit on, see the [[scooter]] tag.

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Motorized scooter":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motorized_scooter]

title: kikumon
body:
(For "a Japanese slang word with the same pronunciation":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E8%8F%8A%E9%96%80], see [[anus]].)

菊花紋章 ([i]kikka monshou[/i]), 菊紋 ([i]kikumon[/i]), 菊花紋 ([i]kikka-mon[/i]) or 菊の御紋 ([i]kiku no gomon[/i]) 

A stylized depiction of a 16 petal [[chrysanthemum]] flower, used by the Emperor of Japan and the Imperial Family. It is most notably seen on the bows of warships of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] and on the covers of Japanese passports. Be careful not to confuse it with the 5 petal [[sakuramon]].

For clear examples, check the [[obi]]'s of Akiha (post #15614) and Megurine Luka (post #568974), and the bottom-right side of Yuyuko's kimono (post #570756).

h4. Reference

* [[Emblem]]

* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: sakuramon
body:
The sakuramon (桜紋) is a stylized depiction of a five-petaled [[cherry_blossoms|cherry blossom]]. The tips of the petals often feature an indent.

It is notably used on rank and cap badges of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] and all branches of the Japan Self-Defense Forces. It frequently shows up in copyrights with a naval theme. In [[Azur Lane]] it's used as the emblem of the Sakura Empire and appears on many of that nation's characters. It's also seen on several [[Kantai Collection]] characters, where it is often mistaken for a [[kikumon]].

h4. Reference

!asset #7734352

body:
[b]Asa no ha[/b] (lit. "hemp leaves") is a traditional Japanese pattern resembling overlapping six-pointed stars ([[hexagram]]), referred to in mathematics as the triakis triangular tiling. See the left side of post #136039 for a clear example.

For the artist of the same name, see [[asa no ha (awayuki)|]].

title: pokemon_journeys
body:
A [i][[pokemon (Anime)|Pokémon anime]][/i] season announced in 2019 and debuting the same year in Japan.

The official title of the anime in Japan is simply [b]Pocket Monsters[/b], while the international title is [b]Pokemon Journeys: The Series[/b].

Having finally placed at the top of a Pokémon League competition, [[Ash Ketchum]] is one step closer to acheiving his dream of becoming a Pokémon Master. Now he and [[Pikachu]] focus on seeing the world, traveling with their new friend, rookie Trainer [[Goh (pokemon)|]] and his partner, [[Cinderace]], whose goal is to fill his Pokédex and eventually catch the Mythical [[Mew (pokemon)|]]. Can Ash rise through the ranks of the World Coronation Series and meet the Galar Champion and Supreme Monarch [[Leon (pokemon)|]] in the finals?

title: goh_(pokemon)
body:
[[Ash Ketchum|Ash]]'s traveling companion in the [[pokemon journeys|Pokémon Journeys: The Series]].

Goh is a book-smart city boy from Vermilion City in Kanto. When he was six, Goh had a fated encounter with [[Mew (pokemon)|]]. Since then, he has dreamed of catching the mythical pokemon. After meeting Ash and travelling to Galar, Goh meets a [[Scorbunny]], and while he initially turns down the enthusiastic Pokémon, it eventually becomes his starter Pokémon. Now, Goh's goal is to fill his Pokédex, believing it will bring him closer to [[Mew (pokemon)|]], rumored to be the common ancestor of all Pokémon.

He has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]] with [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[black hair]] with [[antenna hair|two ahoges]] sticking out of it. He has [[blue eyes]] and wears dark-colored clothing. Due to the character's [[androgynous]] appearance and a comment by the anime's producer, portraying Goh as an [[otoko no ko]] is quite common.

h4. Official art

title: handheld_vacuum_cleaner
body:
A small lightweight hand portable [[vacuum cleaner]] that is normlaly battery powered.  The first commercial ones were sold in the 70's by Black & Decker, after having developed the concept for NASA's Apollo Program.  Black & Decker sold this style of vacuum under the trademark [i]DustBuster[/i], which due to popularity became a generalized trademark in some countries to refer to handheld vacuums as a whole.

title: codename:_bakery_girl
body:
Officially released by MICA Team in 2013 ("known initially":[http://blog.sina.com.cn/s/blog_51b31af10100dmwo.html] as "Girl of the Bakehouse/Girl in the Bakehouse ~ Withered":[https://twitter.com/SoppoBeard/status/1341962888727175169], a visual novel released in 2008/09, before being overhauled between 2008 and 2013 with Yaomeng's Studio GameMaster, with later plans of a follow-up before a falling out between the two studios occurred; preceded in development by the unfinished "Epiphyllum":[http://blog.sina.com.cn/s/blog_51b31af101009znr.html]), and set in 2092.

It is set in the same universe as MICA's following production, Girls' Frontline, released in 2016. GF takes place in 2062, roughly 30 years before the events of Bakery Girl.

In 2019, MICA announced that they would be remaking Codename: Bakery Girl, now titled "[[reverse collapse (series)|Reverse Collapse]]: Codename Bakery", for PC, mobile devices, and the Switch. It would release in 2024.

h4. See also

title: bouzouki
body: The bouzouki is a musical [[instrument]] popular in [[Greece]]. It is a member of the long-necked lute family, with a round body with a flat top and a long neck with a fretted fingerboard. It has steel strings and is played with a [[plectrum]] producing a sharp metallic sound, reminiscent of a [[mandolin]] but pitched lower. There are two main types of bouzouki: the trichordo (three-course) has three pairs of strings (known as courses) and the tetrachordo (four-course) has four pairs of strings. The instrument was brought to Greece in the early 1900s by Greek immigrants from Anatolia, and quickly became the central instrument to the rebetiko genre and its music branches. It is now an important element of modern Laïko pop Greek music.

title: invasion_of_normandy
body:
[b]The Invasion of Normandy[/b], also known as [b][[D-Day]][/b] or [b]Operation Overlord[/b], was an Allied operation that launched the successful invasion of [[germany|German]]-occupied Western Europe during [[World War II]]. 

The operation was launched on 6 June 1944 with the Normandy landings ([b]Operation Neptune[/b]). A 1,200-plane airborne assault preceded an amphibious assault involving more than 5,000 vessels. Nearly 160,000 troops crossed the English Channel on 6 June, and more than two million Allied troops were in [[France]] by the end of August 1944.

h4. See also
* [[Omaha Beach]]
* [[Battle of Carentan]]
* [[Battle of Caen]]

* [[Saving Private Ryan]]
* [[Band of Brothers]]

* [[101st Airborne]]

* [[Battle of France]]

title: entrapta
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] franchise. 

She first appeared in the second cartoon series [i][b]She-Ra: Princess of Power[/b][/i] in 1985, and later in re-imagined form in [i][b][[She-Ra and the Princesses of Power]][/b][/i] in 2018.

Both versions have [[absurdly_long_hair|extremely long]] [[prehensile hair]] and are skilled at designing and building complex machinery.

The original version has the same tall athletic build as the other characters in the series, has pinkish-red hair and wears an outfit consisting of a gold headdress, a top with a high collar, a [[miniskirt]] with a golden belt, long gloves, and [[high heel boots]].

The reimagined version is shorter and thinner, has [[purple hair]] and [[dark skin]], and wears dark purple overalls, a white shirt, and heavy gloves and boots.

title: billy_herrington
body:
[b]William Glen Harold Herrington[/b] (July 14, 1969 - March 2, 2018)

A bisexual American actor and main character in [[Gachimuchi]] universe, best known for his [[yaoi|gay]] pants wrestling and gay pornography.

Herrington has become an internet [[meme]] among Japan's online communities after a pants wrestling video with [[Danny Lee]] was posted on [[NicoNico]] in 2007. He is affectionately called [b]"Big Brother" (兄貴 aniki)[/b] among the Nico Nico Douga community and later worldwide.

He became famous worldwide after Billy himself revealed that he is one of the fans of the Swedish gaming channel in [[Twitch.TV]] named Forsen. After that Billy's fans came to Forsen's channel and played various Gachimuchi music (by donating and playing music). This later spawned a word for calling gachimuchi fans as [b]gachiGASM[/b]. In Forsen's birthday in 2016, Billy sent a Happy Birthday clip when he traveled to [[Greece]] to Forsen via his Twitter, surprising Forsen and making him laugh. Later Forsen made a birthday clip for Billy. Billy's face later became an [[emoticon]] in BTTV addons for Twitch.tv named gachiGASM.

Billy offically visits [[Japan]] twice after a Niconico invitation in 2009 and 2012 and an unofficial visit in 2016. He also officially visited [[China]] and [[Taiwan]] in 2016 and 2018 after a [[Bilibili]] invitation.

Billy Herrington passed away in March 2018 following a car accident.

h4. See also

* [[Danny Lee]]
* [[Van Darkholme]]
* [[tag group:people]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Billy Herrington":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Herrington
* "Twitter: Billyherring777":https://twitter.com/billyherring777
