title: toyota_gazoo_racing
body:
[[Toyota]]'s official motorsports branch. Toyota Gazoo Racing directly participates as a factory team in [[World Endurance Championship]], [[World Rally Championship]], [[Super Taikyu]], [[Dakar Rally]], and the [[Nurburgring]] 24 Hours. In addition, they also provide vehicle development and support for [[Super GT]], [[NASCAR]], [[National Hot Rod Association]], [[Formula Drift]], and various GT3 and GT4 series.

While most of Gazoo Racing's [[racecar]]s are under the main Toyota Brand, including the GT4 [[Toyota Supra Mk V|MK V Supra]], [[Toyota 86|GR86]] Cup Car, and [[toyota gr010|GR010]] [[le mans prototype|Hypercar]], they also have also handled development for [[Lexus]]-branded cars such as the GT3 [[Lexus RC F|RC F]] and GT500 [[Lexus LC|LC 500]].

title: condenser_unit
body: The portion of an [[air conditioner]] affixed outside the home or building.  The condenser unit features a fan to blow outside air across a heat exchanger to cool down heated and vaporized refrigerant used by the AC.  This returns the refrigerant back to a liquid state, which the condenser then will direct back to the internal portion of the AC where it will be used to cool the interior.

title: granblue_fantasy
body:
[b]Granblue Fantasy[/b] (グランブルーファンタジー [i]Guranburuu Fantajii[/i]), officially abbreviated as [b]Granblue[/b] (グラブル [i]Guraburu[/i]), is a mobile turn-based RPG by [[Cygames]], with a Japanese-only release in March 2014, and an English-language release in April 2016. The official anime released in 2017, followed by a second season in 2019. 

The gameplay is heavily reliant on the player's summons and weapons obtained from the gacha system and from in-game raids. The player can equip a maximum of ten weapons and five summons at a time and this is generally referred to as the "weapon grid" and "summon pool".

Granblue is infamous for its competitive week-long event (Guild Wars/Unite & Fight/古戦場) where players farm chunks of meat and try to score more points than their opponent crew for hours at a time. Art is occasionally drawn depicting this in game event, one example being [[post guild war celebration]]s.

h4. Races

Most characters in Granblue Fantasy are divided into 5 races. 

* Human. Most characters fall into this.
* [[Erune]], whose notable features are their animal ears and clothing that expose their backs.
* [[Harvin]], dwarf sized humanoids.
* [[Draph]], humanoids with prominent horns on their heads. Males are tall and muscular, while females are noticeably shorter than the average person, while having big breasts.
* Primal. Primal beasts are creatures that were crafted by the Astral beings long ago. A good number of them (usually humanoid) end up joining the player's crew for one reason or another. 

h4. Protagonist

The player is represented by either [[Gran_(granblue_fantasy)|]] or [[Djeeta_(granblue_fantasy)|]] based on their gender selection and this can be changed at any time. The player may also change their class at any time which also changes their costume.

h4. Characters

Major story characters include:
* [[lyria (granblue fantasy)|Lyria]] 
* [[vyrn (granblue fantasy)|Vyrn]] 
* [[katalina (granblue fantasy)|Katalina]] 
* [[eugen_(granblue_fantasy)|Eugen]] 
* [[io (granblue fantasy)|Io]] 
* [[rackam (granblue fantasy)|Rackam]] 
* [[rosetta (granblue fantasy)|Rosetta]] 

For a full list of characters including NPCs, see the "English wiki list":[https://gbf.wiki/All_Characters] or the Japanese wiki list (for "Playable Characters":[https://gbf-wiki.com/index.php?%C1%B4%A5%AD%A5%E3%A5%E9%A5%AF%A5%BF%A1%BC%B0%EC%CD%F7] and for "NPC Characters":[https://gbf-wiki.com/index.php?%A5%B9%A5%C8%A1%BC%A5%EA%A1%BC%A5%AD%A5%E3%A5%E9]).

h4. See also

* [[Granblue Fantasy Versus]]
* [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]]
* [[Granblue Fantasy: Relink]]

h4. External links

* "Official Granblue Fantasy Twitter (Japanese)":https://twitter.com/granbluefantasy/
* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki (EN)":https://gbf.wiki/
* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki (JP)":http://gbf-wiki.com/
* "Granblue Fantasy Image Viewer":https://gbf-img.com/
* "Wikipedia: Granblue Fantasy":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Granblue_Fantasy

title: dune_(2021_movie)
body:
[b]Dune: Part One[/b] is a 2021 movie adaptation of the first half of the original [i][[dune_(series)|Dune]][/i] novel from the 60s by Frank Herbert, directed by "Denis Villeneuve":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denis_Villeneuve. Originally scheduled for release in late [[2020]], it was "one of the many films delayed by COVID-19":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_films_impacted_by_the_COVID-19_pandemic, and was released on 22 October, 2021 both in [[movie theater|theaters]] and on streaming on HBO MAX (in the [[United States]]). A sequel titled [i][[Dune: Part Two]][/i] was released worldwide on March 1, 2024, also directed by Denis Villeneuve. 

It was the second film adaption of [i]Dune[/i] after [[dune (1984 movie)|David Lynch's Dune]] in [[1984 (year)|1984]], and the third on-screen adaption since the [i]"Frank Herbert's Dune":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Herbert%27s_Dune[/i] miniseries in [[2000]].

h4.See also
* [[Dune: Part Two]]
* [[Dune (series)]]

title: yuki_onna
body:
Yuki-onna (雪女, lit.  [i]snow woman[/i]) is a [[traditional youkai]] in Japanese mythology. She is often depicted as a tall, beautiful woman with long hair that appears during snowy nights, with inhumanly pale or even transparent skin that blends in with the snow and gives her a [[ghost]]ly appearance. In some stories, the yuki onna displays [[demon girl]]-like traits.

h4. Notable Yuki Onna

* [[Letty Whiterock]] from [[Touhou]]
* [[Aoi (GeGeGe no Kitarou)|Aoi]] from [[GeGeGe no Kitarou]]
* [[Shirayuki Mizore]] from [[Rosario+Vampire]]
* [[Yuki Onna (Nurarihyon no Mago)|Yuki-Onna]] (a.k.a. Oikawa Tsurara) from [[Nurarihyon no Mago]] 
* [[Froslass]] from [[Pokemon]]
* [[yukina (yu yu hakusho)|Yukina]] from [[Yu Yu Hakusho|Yu Yu Hakusho]]
* [[yukime_(jigoku_sensei_nube)|Yukime]] from [[Jigoku Sensei Nube]]
* [[Oyuki (Urusei Yatsura)|Oyuki]] from [[Urusei Yatsura]]
* [[kusakabe_yuki_(demi-chan_wa_kataritai)|Kusakabe Yuki]] from [[Demi-chan wa Kataritai]]

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Yuki-onna":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuki-onna

title: arthur_kingsmen
body:
[i][[Mystery Skulls|Mystery Skulls Animated]][/i] character.

The mechanic and driver of the Mystery Skulls, and the owner of [[Mystery (mystery skulls)|]]. He was possessed by a malevolent entity and pushed the former leader, [[Lewis Pepper]], off a cliff, but does not remember this happening and continues to search for him. Nervous to a fault and easily spooked. Seems to be jealous of Lewis and [[Yukino Vivi]]'s relationship.

title: star_wars:_the_high_republic
body:
A multimedia subseries of the [[Star Wars]] franchise, first released in 2021. The High Republic introduces a new era in the Disney canon, set between 500 to 100 years prior to the films. 

Currently, The High Republic series consists of several novels, comics, and audio dramas, as well as official works originally created in other languages, including a Japanese manga series and a Chinese web novel. The upcoming Disney+ steaming series "The Acolyte" is also set in the High Republic era.

title: alleyne_(queen's_blade)
body:
[b]Alleyne[/b] (アレイン) is a character from [[Queen's Blade]]. Voiced by [[Kitamura Eri]], designed by [[Matsuryuu]]. She is the one who appointed [[Nowa (queen's blade)|]] as guardian of the forest, and a veteran elven soldier. She has long [[grey hair]] (later [[blonde hair]] in [[Queen's Blade Unlimited]]) with a side braid and blue eyes. Wears a red beret and fights with a double-headed spear.

Alleyne's combat book: pool #805

h4. Variations

* [[fighting_master_alleyne|Alleyne (Fighting Master)]]
* [[Alleyne (Queen's Blade Unlimited)]]

title: o'neill_cylinder
body:
A [[space habitat]] design by "Gerard K. O'Neill":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerard_K._O%27Neill].
He called that particular design "Island Three" in his 1976 book "The High Frontier: Human Colonies in Space":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_High_Frontier:_Human_Colonies_in_Space].

This cylinder-type design is known for appearing (and [[colony_drop|being dropped]]) in most of the [[Gundam]] series ("with a few exceptions":[http://gundam.wikia.com/wiki/Space_Colony#Additional_Colonies]). 

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/O%27Neill_cylinder]

title: samurai_jacket_(cyberpunk)
body:
A jacket from [[Cyberpunk 2077]] originally worn by [[Johnny Silverhand]] when he played in his rock band Samurai. It's also known as [[V (cyberpunk)|]]'s jacket thanks to its appearance in most of the game's promotional material making it their trademark outfit.

Its most notable feature is the raised collar with glowing lights on the inside. The back of the jacket displays Samurai's logo, a red cybernetic [[oni mask]].

Other characters wearing this jacket should not be tagged with V unless they're specifically cosplaying them.

h4. See also
* [[meme attire]]

title: crucible_knight
body:
[b]Crucible Knights[/b] are minor bosses and rare enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. They wear bronze-coloured, [[full armor|full]] [[plate armor]] with ornately [[horned helmet|horned]], [[covered face|face-overing]] [[helmet]]s, and wield a [[greatsword]] and [[spiked shield]], or [[spear]].

They are capable of projecting phantasmal [[wings]] and [[tail]]s, and some breathe [[fire]].

h4. See also

* [[Tanith's Knight]]
